main event: A light blue light, same as 2nd magnitude star, appeared rapidly but not as fast as a meteor, and disappeared below the horizon to the south.
interesting points: The light was observed for 10-15 seconds.
The light was descending rapidly, but not as fast as a meteor would appear overhead.
The light disappeared below the horizon to the south-southeast (approximately 172 degrees).
The observer was in a C-118 aircraft at 12,000 feet, 248 degrees magnetic, 0.25 knots, over the area between Wake Island and Hickam AFB.
The weather conditions were dark with no moon, clear sky, and scattered cumulus clouds.
sighted object: a light blue light, same as a 2nd magnitude star
location: between Wake Island and Hickam AFB
witnesses: a crew member in a C-118 aircraft
